text.content:
NURSING NOTE 
    1900 - 0700

    Has there been a FALL in the past 48 hours? 
         No

P: Mobility
I: Assist to chair and ambulate
E: Pt oob to chair

PROBLEM LIST AND GOALS
~~~~ 
PAIN
~~~~
      PROBLEM or Need:  PAIN (Pain scale > 4, or patient requests 
intervention)
Goal: Pain scale scale < 4, or patient reports acceptable pain level.
Target date: Within 72 hours of admission. 

                 Problem status:  IN PROGRESS
   INTERVENTIONS
   Pain Management (NIC #1400)
   Definition: Alleviation of pain or a reduction in pain to a level of 
comfort
   that is acceptable to the patient.
   Patient uses distraction.
   Assess comfort needs q 4 hours. 
   If pain continues at greater than or equal to 4, complete Basic Pain
   Assessment/Reassessment(WILDCATS).
   Control environmental factors that may influence patient's response to 
   discomfort.
 
   Reduce or eliminate factors that are barriers to pain management.
 
   EVALUATION:  pain is improving

Patient and/or Significant Other has had input and agreed to the plan of 
care.
IV ACCESS
   Peripheral IV 
     Size:20 g
     Location:Right Hand 
     Date placed:May 30,2012

2000 - pt states she is feeling "a lot better tonight"  assessment completed, 
reviewed plan of care.

2200 - pt independant with evening cares

2300 - pt is afebrile

MN - pt resting, abx given

0200 - pt resting

0322 pt awake, requesting stand by assistance to the BR. 

0400 - pt is resting

0600 - pt awakened for am labs, antibiotics

0700 - report to day shift RN.  No events overnight.  pt resting most of 
night.
text.author: NURSE,TWENTY-NINE
